_header: Thou art for us before yea Father him for to queme
Subjects: sermons, verse in; Christ, prayers to; Christ, plea to the father; prayers, to Christ
_description: Mankind’s prayer to Christ, in a Latin sermon — two couplets

CULIi38.Transcription:
þou art for vs bifore ȝe fadur hym fort to quemeþou
                    schalt come a domesday vs fort demeand þarfore helpe vs þi
                    seruaunsȝ þat þou hast i wrouthwiche witȝ þi
                    derworȝ blod þou hast i bouth
CULIi38.Editions:
Erb,  Peter C. 
             “Vernacular Material for Preaching in MS Camb. Univ. Lib.
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         33 (1971): 63-84: 74.
